name: insolubility
content:
insolubility noun [U]
(PROBLEM)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very difficult or impossible to solve: She tried to laugh about the insolubility of the problems. The murder has always aroused great curiosity because of its insolubility.
More examplesFewer examplesThe crisis had reached the verge of insolubility.The insolubility of the fundamental problem of ethics was impressed on me.His statement exemplifies the current insolubility of the conflict.

insolubility noun [U]
(SUBSTANCE)
the quality of being impossible to dissolve: The cause of the detergent's insolubility was not clear. Fuels like butanol have the same sort of solubility or insolubility with water that gasoline does. See
insoluble
More examplesFewer examplesInvestigations have been difficult because of the lacquer's insolubility in the usual solvents.These stains are very difficult to remove owing to their insolubility and resistance to wetting.I can reverse the insolubility of the substance by adding silicate.
